subject: Passing parameters to methods (was RE: [junit] Re: Can I create a dynamic JUnit ?  (in Cactus Framework))
msgSnippet: ... Donny Widjaja ... Right, this is the typical pattern to use in JUnit when you want to pass parameters to your test methods. Still, it s far from perfect
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
Donny Widjaja

> However, just for future reference this is a sample on how to
> pass parameter into JUnit test cases.

Right, this is the typical pattern to use in JUnit when you want to pass
parameters to your test methods.

Still, it's far from perfect since you have to create one field on your
class per parameter, make sure this state is maintained across methods and
then read this state in the method.

Basically, imagine that Java didn't let you pass parameters to methods...
not very pleasant, uh?

Compare:

public class A extends TestCase {
private String m_name;
private String m_xmlFileName;

public A(String name, String xmlFileName) {
m_name = name;
m_xmlFileName = xmlFileName;
}

public void testName() {
// do something with m_name
}

public void testXmlFileName) {
// do something with m_xmlFileName
}
}

To:

// TestNG class
public class A {
@Test(parameters = { "name" })
public void verifyName(String name) {
}

@Test(parameters = { "xmlFileName" })
public void xmlIsValid(String xmlFileName) {
}
}
